data.fullContent: Copper is the most widely used conductor in many kinds of electrical wiring. Copper has the lowest resistance to the flow of electricity of all non-precious metals. Electrical wiring in buildings is the most important market for the copper industry. About half of all copper mined is used to make electrical wire and cable conductors.
data.answer: 在许多种类的电线中，铜是使用最广泛的导体。在所有的非贵金属中，铜对电流的电阻最低。建筑物内的电线是铜业最重要的市场。大约有一半开采的铜被用于制造电线和电缆导体。
